Dear All,


I have tried to run the xor experiment several times for severa=
l number of generations.

1) xor_test(5), works every time.
2) xor_test(10)=
, works every time
3) xor_test(100), worked only once out of 10 or so trial=
s.

I tried to investigate further. It seems that the program is getting st=
uck while trying to calculate the network depth inside the function xor_eva=
luate() [experiments.cpp]

Line 158:  net=3Dorg->net;
Line 159:  numnodes=
=3D((org->gnome)->nodes).size();
Line 160:
Line 161:  net_depth=3Dnet->max_=
depth(); // GETTING STUCK HERE

I tried to look deeper. The function Networ=
k::depth(arguments) is itself pretty simple. It is actually getting stuck i=
nside NNode::depth(arguments) which is a function defined in nnode.cpp on l=
ine 399. This is a recursive function. It is getting stuck even when the re=
cursion is off.

Kindly advise. 


Ashish
